website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality, 100% meat option that is loved by most dogs but may be prohibitively expensive for some owners.
pros: Comes in Turkey Gourmet Gobbler flavor (14 oz
100% real meat that is sized well for both large and small dogs
Very high-quality food that most dogs seem to love
Reports of dogs having more energy and fewer allergies while on this food
cons: Bag is small and quite expensive compared to other options, making this a better choice for smaller dogs
Some reports of dogs refusing to eat this brand

customer_reviews.title: Never ever again!
customer_reviews.text: First bag; food was rock hard. Seller sent replacement. Within 2 days, one dog was throwing up & one has bad diarrhea!! This is all I changed! I only gave a tablespoon of this as a topper & both are sick! My 7 year old lab has never thrown up in her life; not once, until eating this! I asked the manufacturer if the meat for this dog food ever grazed on/or was fed anything with pesticides and they refused to answer!! My guess is the origin of this meat is in question. Ask yourself, I’ve asked in 3 different places & cannot get a real response!
customer_reviews.author: Lolo

customer_reviews.title: THOUGHT THIS WOULD BE A NICE TREAT FOR MY DOGS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I thought it would be a nice treat for my dogs. I have 2 Maltese dogs who are currently on Blue Buffalo dog food. Long story short: my dogs won't eat this product. They tasted it, but refused to eat it even when I left it there for a couple of days. They would rather starve than eat this food; which is very pricey indeed. Almost $30 for 14 oz. An expensive lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Rizzo

customer_reviews.title: We have a finicky eater and have found that he only like freeze dried raw dog food
customer_reviews.text: New for us dog food. We have a finicky eater and have found that he only like freeze dried raw dog food. We are always looking for new brands to add to the rotation because he seems to be happier with a variety. We do not mix with water because he likes the crunchy texture and will not eat it if it softens up at all. He always drinks a good quantity of water when he is done eating though. Quick delivery. Rated 5 stars by Dog Food Adviser, and our dog...perfect!
customer_reviews.author: mek

customer_reviews.title: Pups Love!
customer_reviews.text: I have two giant, beautiful Golden Retrievers puppies who are surprisingly picky eaters, unless you include dish towels and earrings. I added this product to their regular kibble and they love it. I realize you can add water and feed them less, I’m just going to add ithis as a supplement to regular food since I would be spending more money feeding them a month than my family. Appx. 60 pounds of this a month would be insanely expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: My dog, that is a very picky 17 pound Havanese, likes these. They are small, hard and 'crunchy'. If you prefer softer food they have 'salmon, and bison liver' or 'bison' liver. My dog prefers soft and small food and treats. I recommend phasing it in as any change seems to cause some diarrhea. I feel good that he will eat them as the ingredients are all good for him. I recommend supporting this small business in the midwest US (I have no relation other then as a consumer; TruDog is the company), will buy again, and I hope this helps someone and their dog/s.
customer_reviews.author: A Long-time Prime Person

customer_reviews.title: They LOVE it. Only reason I gave only 4 stars ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only fed this to my dogs twice so far, and even only at 25% of their meal, but they gobble it up! They LOVE it. Only reason I gave only 4 stars is because of the price. I'm sure it's a quality product and is priced fairly, I'm just not sure we can afford to feed it to BOTH of our dogs full time. But, it's a great product! Edited to add: at 25% this bag only lasted our dogs 4 days. That would be unbelievably pricey full time. They sure did love it though.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Moseley

customer_reviews.title: Real meat for real dogs
customer_reviews.text: I have three very picky yorkies who are a nightmare when it comes to dinner time. One of them has allergies as well. They’ve been in this food for months now, itching is at s minimum, their poops are much smaller, and thehave the energy of a puppy. You can’t find a better natural dog food than Tru Dog. I even ordered other items from them and they are winner as well. Customer support is to notch...you couldn’t find better!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: TrueDog Crunchy Muchy Gourmet food
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality food, my dog loves it, I can only recommend this product if you want to make sure your dog eats healthy then this is the food to get, it also last long because the dog does not require that much food because he gets all the nutrition that he needs, I have a 114 lbs. Rottweiler (2 years of age).......I purchased one bag and this bag last almost 1 1/2 month, my dog is in very good body condition, full of energy and he is very healthy!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Petra

customer_reviews.title: MY DIVA IS HAPPY!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 5 month old Shorkie who would NOT eat anything! I spent $$$$$$$$ on food and organic fresh meat! I tried 14 dry foods, 8 can foods, frozen raw 2 high end companies, home cooked using organic fresh chicken and fillet mignon and she was NOT happy. I received my Trudog Beef yesterday and she loved it!!! Ate every bite wanting more!!! I did not transition her because she wasn't eating anything. So far 3 finished TRUDOG meals no stomach upset. LOVE LOVE this food! My little Princess does too!!! Will update if any issues arise. WORTH THE PRICE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Worth it?  Probably.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has a semi-tender stomach. We are in the changeover phase with the new food. As far as flavor and scent are concerned, our dog thinks horrible garbage smells and tastes good so that is no issue. I am really hoping this non-toxic American made food helps him turn the corner on eating grass and barfing so often. 11/9/19 update....apparently the beef based food has been discontinued. I have no idea why. The turkey based food seems to be as good. I have seen longer times between his barfings. It still happens even though he is allowed zero access to garbage and table scraps.
customer_reviews.author: turtle

customer_reviews.title: Don't get much for your money
customer_reviews.text: It's great food, conveniently packaged, and my dogs love it, but if I'd fed one dog just the TruDog it would only have lasted 2 days (my dog is 60 lbs.) If you have a Pomeranian this would probably last a little while, but anyone with bigger dogs would be better off making their own raw dog food like we've started doing. It's not hard and would be much cheaper than feeding your dog just the TruDog. This could work to supplement other commercial foods, I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Jackson

customer_reviews.title: That being said this product made my dog itch terribly.
customer_reviews.text: My dog eats a very healthy diet and is not used to junk foods or other food items that are unlike this product. That being said this product made my dog itch terribly. Weird
customer_reviews.author: Sophina W.

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog vomit
customer_reviews.text: It looks like kinda high quality dog food. Maybe it is....regardless, almost everytime I feed this to my dog he pukes it up a few minutes later. I followed the preparation directions on the bag, so I don't know what went wrong. My dog is a pug, just like the one pictured on the bag that I bought. I would assume it would be good and easy for pugs to eat. The pieces of dog food seemed a little large for a pug, and they didn't really get soft after mixing into some hot water (as recommended). Won't be purchasing this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry J.

customer_reviews.title: Quality food that dogs love
customer_reviews.text: This dog food is REALLY expensive, but our dogs love it and it's the only thing that I can feed my female Cardigan Corgi that keeps her from gaining weight. Unfortunately, I only get 3 meals out of the 10oz bags, so it's really expensive. I kid my dog that I'm going to have to get a second job just to feed her, but with the cost of this dog food, it's not exactly a joke. The food is good quality, she LOVES it, doesn't gain weight from it, it smells good and the only negative is the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Shephard

customer_reviews.title: My picky Malti-Poo
customer_reviews.text: I have 8 years old extremely picky eater malt-poo. I have spent fortune in places like Petsmart, Petco, etc to find healthy dog food my Buster might eat. I failed every time. TruDog however seems to be the only one he eats till his bowl is clean. So happy with this. Yes, its pricy but fortunately my dog is small and I trust the top notch ingredient they choose to use. Only concern is that its almost all beef and no veggies in there. So I add cooked and minced broccoli when I feed. Buster loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Noriko Meguro

customer_reviews.title: My dog didn't care for it.
customer_reviews.text: The one star is from my Lhasa Apso, not me. He's usually not very picky and I was hoping to get him to change to this because it seemed that it would be a very healthy food. He wouldn't touch it. He sniffed it and refused it over and over. I tried about 8 times over a period of a couple months but had no luck getting him to eat it. This product comes dried and you must add water to it. It smelled like liver after it's cooked which I don't really care for. It is also quite pricey compared to many other foods.
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: I wrote to the company about this, I gave ...
customer_reviews.text: I wrote to the company about this, I gave my 7 month old dog some of the 2 days ago, about 2 tablespoons. He has thrown up now for 3 days. I'm very worried. I will just return it!
customer_reviews.author: sandy howell

customer_reviews.title: My Japanese Chin love it!
customer_reviews.text: Well, my dogs do. They are on a raw diet doing well. I use this when they want a change from their regular food. It is easier to use because it doesn't require refrigeration and stores easily. Great for those trips, too.
customer_reviews.author: RNRita

customer_reviews.title: Finally A Dog Food My dog will eat!
customer_reviews.text: I have spent more money trying to find a dog food my little Yorkiepoo would eat. Finally, I saw an add on the Internet and decided to try it, TreDog. She loves it!! I was so thrilled to see her gobble down a dog food she likes!!
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis L. Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like the TURKEY ... but LOVES the BEEF!
customer_reviews.text: My dachshund puppy LOVES the Beef but thought I would give her something different and ordered the Turkey and she wouldn't touch it so sadly having to return that package and stick with the Beef. Like I said she LOVES....LOVES it. So good for her too. I add a little cottage cheese, sweet potatoes, honey dew to her breakfast to help it go a little further since it is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Alcorn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for both our senior dogs!
customer_reviews.text: We have a small poodle who has an equally dainty appetite. We found this food and she's been doing great, always eager to eat now. We add a small amount to a good quality dry food. We also have a soft-coated wheaten terrier who has a sensitive stomach. Since we've been feeding TruDog, again with dry food, he hasn't had any vomiting or diarrhea, which had been a long-standing problem. We feed this dry, not rehydrated.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Gorman

customer_reviews.title: Pricey...but a great product
customer_reviews.text: Pricey.... but a great product. In the long run you will save money by having less vet bills for allergies, digestive issues, hot spots, and many other problems caused by poor food!
customer_reviews.author: Mimi F.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but healthy food for the pups.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is really expensive, although I got a bag for Black Friday price, so that was nice. Considering it is all meat, bones, & organs, and pelletized and dried/freeze dried...it's a pretty labor intensive food product, so the cost is understandable. I feel good using this as a supplement / topper at meal times, but there is absolutely no way I could feed it alone at the cost (too many dogs).
customer_reviews.author: Melisse

customer_reviews.title: Raw Food Minus Chihuahua Toots
customer_reviews.text: I had to put my dog on a special diet after it was discovered she has a heart condition. I had her on other raw food that she loved but it made her toot. I talked to a dog nutritionist who said it was probably the fruit and veggies they put in it. This is all meat and good stuff, my dog loves it and the stinky dog farts are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Healthy choice of food for my dogs.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. TruDog makes wonderful freeze dried & healthy food for your pet (dogs) We have 3 Yorkies and sometimes you know how finicky they can get, but the 3 of them really enjoy it, and eat it as is, I do not even have to add warm water or anything. We do supplement their diets with other fresh veggies & fruit from our pantry & refrigerator, but we know they are getting a great natural, high protein diet.
customer_reviews.author: Peggy K. Dapitan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food and so do I! She is doing amazingly well on it/1
customer_reviews.author: Carolina CB

customer_reviews.title: Very pricey for what you get!
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves it! She isn’t a picky eater so it wasn’t a suprise. I was suprise that it was only “half way full”. This is the most expensive dog food I ever bought my pup. I won’t be feeding her this alone because I can’t afford it. This will be mixed with her normal dog food. The smell is very overwhelming but it doesn’t bother my pup so That’s good. Hoping it last her a month atleast when mixing with her other food. No upset stomach. Her poop seems to be smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Amber H.

customer_reviews.title: Good dog food but terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves the Crunchy Munchy Beef Bonanza. It's really the first dog food he's eaten with any consistency. My only "complaint" is about TruDog's customer service. I had an issue after my second order so I called TruDog - suffice it to say that not only wasn't my issue resolved, but I was told a manager/supervisor would call me back the next day which never happened. I was very disappointed and the only reason I still purchase the food is because I can do it through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Seitz

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but good for some dogs.
customer_reviews.text: My small dogs love this and it seems to give them more energy and playfulness. However, they have both developed dry skin and scratch alot. I've tried adding omega 3-6-9 oils and bathing conditioners, but the dry skin persists. I am trying the beef to see if it does the same as the turkey. They really love this food, so I hope I can find the right combo to make it work. I add it to their regular kibble, since it is so expensive. They always leave a little kibble behind.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Emerick

customer_reviews.title: I love it and since she has started having this food ...
customer_reviews.text: I would give this food 5 stars but we have a lab and to feed her exclusively TruDog food would cost a fortune! I love it and since she has started having this food "added" to her regular food (which is high quality) we haven't had as many issue with tummy trouble, to put it as mildly as I can. For an 80 lb dog we would have to feed her almost 5 cups of this food and the 10 oz. bag is 19.99 so you don't have to be a math whiz to figure this one out. It would cost more to feed her than it does to feed us! That said, she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Trudog your dog will love it.
customer_reviews.text: This is some of the best stuff that I have ever gotten for my dog. He loves it and it's good for him. As soon as he hears the rattle of the bag he comes running.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good food, company not so much
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this food. I use as a supplement and treats, being careful not to over feed. My only complaint isn't about the food but the hassle with the company itself and it's auto-ship system. I will not purchase via the company but only through a third party. It's worth the little extra, if any, than dealing with Trudog customer service or their web site.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: KUDOS
customer_reviews.text: I had lost a 7 year young Golden Retriever to cancer a number of years ago, so when my current Golden started acting not interested in eating, I felt it was a wake up call. After doing my research, this is the food I chose. We are now in day 4, and he eats every last morsel. It is rather expensive, but I no longer need to add bits of (cooked) meat, and if it helps my fur baby live longer, healthier and happier, it's worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Bohnsack

customer_reviews.title: Bag size is ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe we would have to purchase more than 10! bags a month for our 36 lbs dog. This is absolutely insane. Seems like a very environmental friendly company. No matter how good or bad the food is, this is a BIG reason to not buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Corinne K.

customer_reviews.title: Very heated dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes it but the crushed bones sometimes hurt her, maybe some aren't crushed well. My daughter and I noticed that both our dogs go in heat right after eating this. They never did this before. One of our dogs now has swollen mammary lumps. I'm wondering if the meats and organs are organic at all? Can anyone else tell me if they notice this in their dogs too?
customer_reviews.author: Igeorges1220

customer_reviews.title: I found some freeze dried stuff by Merrick that he eats better from the pet store -- that's expensive too but ...
customer_reviews.text: Dog eats it sort of, but not the reception I was hoping for. Way too expensive for a mediocre response from my dog -- but in all fairness, he is a very picky eater. I found some freeze dried stuff by Merrick that he eats better from the pet store -- that's expensive too but its a bigger bag and the dog eats it better. Do not mean to bash this product -- just my dog's reaction and my reaction to the cost, that's all. Again, dog is hot and cold on foods so I would probably buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I have been noticing plastic pieces in this food. I have very tiny Yorkie's. I would love to show you my video of what I pulled out of the nugget. It was a folded straw. If I wouldn't have noticed it and one of my fur babies ate it, they would have chocked to death. I have contacted Trudog but they are making up excuses.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Price increases of 100%??!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this food. After being a subscriber for years just got their email announcing an increase with no other details other than “you don’t have to do anything because it will be automatically applied.“ No mention that price was Doubling! It was a 100% increase. Disappointing way to treat loyal customers.
customer_reviews.author: CBF

customer_reviews.title: Great for my Dog, not my Budget.
customer_reviews.text: My dog, Zoe loved this food as I mixed it in with her regular food for a taste test. She would scoop some dog food from her bowl and drop it on the floor to eat only the freeze-dried dog food. It was a hoot to watch but at $27.00, I anticipated more dog food than received and that is great for her, but not my budget. I will try to find a similar brand, just a bit less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Shille

customer_reviews.title: All time best food for your dog
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this pet food for about a year now. I usually order direct through their club and get points. However, I was concerned I might run out before my next auto ship, so ordered through Amazon with something else. My two little dogs love this food (freeze dried) and very healthy because of it. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: dkeyser

customer_reviews.title: dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: I'm amused I'm rating "flavor" I don't eat them. but my dog loves them... so I'm presuming they have great flavor. and I'm attracted to a product that states they don't put unhealthy ingredients in there for my dog/third child. (he has enough toys one might think he was a child)
customer_reviews.author: Kristin B.

customer_reviews.title: Best food out there!
customer_reviews.text: Best food! My toy wiener dogs were very difficult to feed. Went through just about every brand with no luck. They would not want to eat. Now they run and are excited about feeding time and gobble it up. Big difference in their behavior too. Happier and their coats are soft and shiny. One of my dogs was over weight. She has now actually slimmed down and getting to a healthy weight.
customer_reviews.author: Book Worm

customer_reviews.title: they would have liked it. Being that they are 3 & 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: Although my teeny, tiny dogs weren't interested in this raw food diet, I'm not so sure that if I pushed the concept on them for an extended time, they would have liked it. Being that they are 3 & 4 lb. dogs, I decided to go back to their cooked dog food. The concept is a good one, so I'm just sorry that I tried this dog food too late. The raw diet is probably the healthiest one, but I won't push it on them, as these dogs are tiny & fragile. I tried introducing it to them as per the package suggests, but these finicky eaters walked away....:(((
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn Born

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. If you love your pet this is most beneficial!
customer_reviews.text: My story, 2 Jack Russells with gastro problems, several vet check ups and special diets. Negative results until we started them on TruPet. Both have stopped having upset stomachs and bowel problems. And an added bonus 1 of them had annual skin rash which has stopped! Well worth it and they both love the food. We make it with a little more warm water because they love the gravy!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great for my pick eater with cancer
customer_reviews.text: My little guy was diagnosed with cancer on February 3rd, and since his surgery and beginning chemo he has become an incredibly picky eater! I tried several brands of moist food, raw kibble, home cooked for him, even tried cat food and he wanted nothing to do with them (most days, on good days he eats anything). I ordered this product after reading about it and discovering that it is not only made in the USA, but all ingredients are sourced in the USA. My dog is in absolute love with this food. The first day I got it he ate his normal portion and then some. So happy to see my guy eating, and eating healthy.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ziolkowski

customer_reviews.title: The dog likes it,but I don't think its a good value.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I couldn't believe how small this bag was for the price of $30.99. I have 3 dogs,2 of them like it,the other one doesnt,and this food stinks. I'm just going to use it very sparingly.The bag is 10 in tall and 8 in wide. I'll just buy Mountain House,freeze dried diced chicken cooked, at 1.06 lbs at $34.20 than pay another $29.00 for .14 oz.
customer_reviews.author: brandyrose

customer_reviews.title: Trudog is not a good dog food, my dogs got sick from it.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with "Trudog" not worth the money. My two dogs got upset stomachs from this product. I gave both my dogs 6 pieces each to see if they liked it, they ate it with their other food as I was advised to introduce it to them a little at a time. They both threw up, 2 days later I tried it again same thing happened. So I waited a week and tried it again same thing happened. I won't buy this again or any Trudog brand again, and there is no refund on the $35 bag.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Dickens

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love this! They are on prescription diet food and I use this as a tasty, tempting topper for their wet food. It’s also a nice treat that is good for them that they love and isn’t too high in calories. I’ve bought this several times and will continue to.
customer_reviews.author: Shelli A.

customer_reviews.title: Great nutrition, she loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a topper because it us so expensive. I heat up a small amount of bone broth and add this to soften it up. Mix it with her dry and she loves it. I like that it gives her some of the benefits of raw organ meat. Stores beautifully. One bag lasts a month.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy M

customer_reviews.title: Picky animal is picky no more
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievable. My Shihzu and chihuahua were the worst. I constantly tried various brands. No sooner than I gave each a single piece my Lil girls lost their minds. They jumped me. Lol. I mixed some with their Wegmans food and they gobbled it down. Bowls completely clean. I will be ordering more. Wish it were sold in stores.
customer_reviews.author: PG Walker

customer_reviews.title: Small amount in bag for price/dog would not eat.
customer_reviews.text: My dog would not eat any of the food. She had always eaten dry door food...but completely disliked. I can't buy this for her anymore ad this product was expensive for the small amount I received. I wanted to give my dog a healthier choice if dog food nut feel I will need to provide her with my own homemade dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta D.

customer_reviews.title: Gracie seems to love it.
customer_reviews.text: It's expensive. Gracie seems to really like it. I feel good providing raw freeze dried kibble bc I believe it is better for her. I cant afford to feed with only Trudog twice a day so I mix with regular kibble. This $30 bag will last me about 7-8 days since I use about 1/2 cup twice dsily.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Draper

customer_reviews.title: Great! If you've won the lottery!
customer_reviews.text: My 5# dog is 16yo. She loves it. After a month she is rejuvenated! I am waiting to see if her dry skin she's always had goes away. Wish I had a $1000 to feed my large guardian dogs! For a month! They usually catch their own raw food though.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie Baker

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua, who is a very picky eater, absolutely loves this food. As soon as I start fixing it he smells it and gets all excited, jumping around. Normally, he is a grazer with his food, eating a little, then coming back later for more, but with this food he scarfs it down right away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outrageous price
customer_reviews.text: Extreme price for what I could make, dry and freeze on my own. Extreme bulk...consistency of cheese puff. Total ripoff.
customer_reviews.author: Retiredman1

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this dog food!
customer_reviews.text: My three dogs LOVE this dog food, but they are Beagles so they love all dog food! The difference is that I know that this dog food is better for them than the regular off the shelf at the local store brands. The only unfortunate part about TruDog is the price. It really is too expensive for me to buy it regularly and although my pack is worth it, I just can't do it all the time, but when I'm able to, I will.
customer_reviews.author: Faye D. Fulone Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff, but Expensive!
customer_reviews.text: My picky dogs love it! May be somewhat constipating? Convenient form for storing and serving. Just VERY expensive. Does not expand when wet. I will probably continue to mix it with their other regular dog food as it encourages them to eat the other foid they do not like as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome food! My dog's are more excited about eating TruDog than they are about eating their favorite treats! I'm very pleased and happy that I found a dog food that is both healthy and that my dogs go nuts over! Plus, my dogs fur has become so silky and shiny since feeding them TD. The vet says that my 8 and 10 year old mutts look much younger than they are!
customer_reviews.author: Mhawk

customer_reviews.title: I feel very comfortable feeding my 2 year old golden doodle Tru Dog
customer_reviews.text: I feel very comfortable feeding my 2 year old golden doodle Tru Dog. She loves it and it agrees with her sensitive stomach. My only complaint is the price.
customer_reviews.author: Apple14

customer_reviews.title: Dogs LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly use it as a healthy treat instead of a food because the dogs love it so much and it lacks fruits and veggies. I also use it as a topper for their dried food. I would love to use this as their food if it had some veggies add, the bag size was bigger and it wasn't so expensive
customer_reviews.author: Harmony R.

customer_reviews.title: My dogs actually ate it.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are super picky. Added some water and they ate it all. It’s a bit pricey so I have been giving it to them once a day and putting the tru dog booster on their other food. My older dog has digestive issues and this has led to a great turn around.
customer_reviews.author: LadyDi59

customer_reviews.title: True Dog FEED me - freeze dried food
customer_reviews.text: I use this food as a treat in treat balls for my 12lb rescue dog. It is pricy but she loves it! It fits into the activity treat balls so it is about the same price per lb of other treats. I purchase when I run out........
customer_reviews.author: PAK on the Lake

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it but it’s way too expensive and I can’t ...
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it but it’s way too expensive and I can’t afford to buy it. Maybe if you lower the price on it you can go by volume instead of charging people through the nose
customer_reviews.author: Wild Irish Rose

customer_reviews.title: Max loves TruDog
customer_reviews.text: Max gets a topping of this in the evening on his kibbles and he just gobbles them up. We have to add water to his food because he had lower jaw surgery for cancer and cannot chew-he is doing great and loves his TruDog
customer_reviews.author: AGGIE MOM

customer_reviews.title: Rip off for the price
customer_reviews.text: Have to put hamburger grease on it so dog will eat. Bought 6 bags, dogs won’t eat, threw up, Vendor says I have to pay to send back. They should sell one bag to see what your dog thinks. My dog thinks not
customer_reviews.author: Janice Matteucci

customer_reviews.title: A really hard  crunch even in warm water for a soft mouth small dog...move on.
customer_reviews.text: I have a pug who chews rocks and eats anything. This is not her favorite. if you have an older tiny dog who may be missing teeth I would say try a different brand. I used it up and will stick with Wysong kibble for crunch
customer_reviews.author: Bk

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the product, well my dogs love the product. They are doing great and never seen them so ready to eat. Love that I can get this on Amazon too.
customer_reviews.author: Pam Medlock

customer_reviews.title: This is the only food they want now
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake buying this, because my dogs love it and won't eat anything else. Now I have to keep getting it. I suppose it is worth the price, because they do not waste a scrap of it. They should add it to subscribe and save.
customer_reviews.author: Missy

customer_reviews.title: my puppy loved this product
customer_reviews.text: At the beginning,my puppy loved this product. She is a very picky eater thou. These days she rather goes for the turkey flavor. It still a great product. The sellers agents are outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: Abu

customer_reviews.title: The only way my chihuahua will eat his food
customer_reviews.text: I sprinkle this on top of my dog's food and it's the only way he will eat it. I initially bought it directly from the company,but it is much cheaper through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: D. Libby

customer_reviews.title: My Boys Don't Eat It
customer_reviews.text: Sadly my boys don't like it, that's why only 3 stars. It doesn't matter how healthy the food is, if the dogs don't eat it. But other than that, the product arrived quickly and it's packaged nicely
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: My Bostons love this food and so do I
customer_reviews.text: We have 2 Boston Terriers and they love this food. They just had their 2 year old checkup and they are healthy, good lungs, heart sounds great clean teeth. Very happy with this dog food. I do not wet it because they love it dry and I can also put a few pieces in my pocket for a treat on a long walk.
customer_reviews.author: anne cotter

customer_reviews.title: I thought this product was way over priced. My ...
customer_reviews.text: I thought this product was way over priced. My dogs weren't crazy about it at all. Most times, the 2 feedings they got out of this small portioned bag they left most of it in their bowls. Not impressed for all the hype around the product.
customer_reviews.author: Luce

customer_reviews.title: Happy Dog
customer_reviews.text: I have a very old dog, almost 18, with just a few teeth left, blind, and deaf but his sense of smell works great and he sniffed out this 'new' food with no problem. He loves it and seems to be a bit stronger and has more energy. Though it's a bit pricey, it is well worth it to see him eating so well and enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Curmudgeon

customer_reviews.title: Great product!  My dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES this food. I have a Great Dane, so it's too expensive to feed him this exclusively, but I use it as a topper for his food. He gobbles it up and it makes me feel better knowing he's getting this raw food in addition to the high quality dry food I feed him. I'm glad this company exists! I just wish there was a way to feed large breed dogs a raw diet like this without it hundreds a month, which I can't afford.
customer_reviews.author: Carolgoat

customer_reviews.title: Pretty pricy and my dog becomes very constipated (even when ...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty pricy and my dog becomes very constipated (even when I use this as an add-on only) :-( I switched to The Honest Kitchen and my dog looks better than ever!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs think this stuff is the tastiest food on the planet!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 dogs and they go crazy for this stuff! It's like crack for dogs, they love it so much! I use the Feed Me kibble instead of dog bones for their evening treat -- just a small handful in their bowls and it's gobbled up in an instant! I'm pretty sure they would eat the entire bag in under a minute if I'd let them, that's how much they love it!
customer_reviews.author: The Schnauzer House

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for picky eaters!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy turns her nose up at high quality kibble and wet food. She will pick around her other food and put on the floor just to get to pieces of tru dog I mix in trying to trick her.
customer_reviews.author: william lukach

customer_reviews.title: Happy and Healthy Dogs
customer_reviews.text: This raw food is nutritious, convenient, and unsmelly, and my dogs--7 and 17 years-old pit-mixes--love it. I use it more as a chewy topper on their raw reconstituted patties, and they gobble it up. Even the senior dog likes the crunchiness. Great to use as training treats, too, without crumbling and greasing up your pockets
customer_reviews.author: Brandy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Freeze dried raw pure meat that dogs LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: My finicky mini poodle puppy LOVES this wholesome food. It is freeze-dried pure raw meat that needs no refrigeration. A dream come true for both you and your furbaby.
customer_reviews.author: Jolie

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old pug Rocco loves this product and I know it’s a small portion but it’s worth a buy. He doesn’t poop as much you can tell he’s getting nutrients. 😉
customer_reviews.author: theresa

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My Yorkie who has always been a picky eater absolutely loves this food. The very small amount for the price is the only reason for not giving it a 5 star rating. I’m a retired educator and on a tight budget.
customer_reviews.author: Mia0007

customer_reviews.title: very fast
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this dog food! I've seen a big difference in them, especially my older dog Buddy, he is 14 yrs young. He is actually playing with his younger sister Baby 3 yrs young . This dog food has made a big difference. Thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Started out enthusiastic but third day in not so much
customer_reviews.text: Started out with enthusiasm but this morning not so much really does not have much scent maybe would be more attractive if it did like ingredients rather expensive especially if I have to beg him to eat!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love the taste, but I don't love the price!
customer_reviews.text: My two little dogs absolutely love this stuff, but it's too darned expensive to give it to them except as a treat. I use the little bites as treats during training, and they are great for that. Sometimes a few pieces mixed into their regular dog food will help get my two picky eaters going.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl A.

customer_reviews.title: My Dog Gives This Product Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: But I only give it two because it's too expensive. Two vets have told me that a raw diet is not good for anyone, dogs included. I also don't like the fact that this item has ended up on the FDA dogfood recall list.
customer_reviews.author: TwoCentsTomlinsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: My two dogs love this food
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs love this food, I give to them as treat.asmall hand full on top of the wet dog food.
customer_reviews.author: anna griffin

customer_reviews.title: my dog hates it
customer_reviews.text: this is a weird one. my dog won't go near it. money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: JDay

customer_reviews.title: Trudog food for dogs you love
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 dogs love this food. I add a small amount into their regular dry food daily.
customer_reviews.author: MEM

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Because of the cost, I use tru dog as a supplement for the grain free chicken kibble that is the bulk of the dog's diet. My dog loves the tru Dog beef and eats it first.
customer_reviews.author: Marta

customer_reviews.title: Great food for a picky dog
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good product. Dogs love it and I have a very picky dog. It’s also easy to use and I feel good about feeding them this product.
customer_reviews.author: D. McDowell

customer_reviews.title: My Yorkie is allergic to everything but meat in most dogfoods, even sweet potatoes.
customer_reviews.text: I put a small handful of this in her bowl and cover with hot water; pour off the water and mix in hamburger I cooked in the micro, and drained. She is allergic to all grains, pasta, rice, root vegetables, flax---you name it---Pet Tabs. This has been a big help to reduce her scratching.
customer_reviews.author: WYmary

customer_reviews.title: dogs LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: The product is awfully expensive HOWEVER if you can splurge once and awhile, it's worth it. My little dog is very picky about her food but with this stuff added to her current kibble she comes running and eats it all.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy and would recommend
customer_reviews.text: We have a lab and a Yorkie, they eat, but I've never seen the enthusiastic behavior displayed upon delivery. All over the package!! I'm mixing with another high grade feed because of the price. I tasted a small chip and you could taste the wildness. Very happy and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it!!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this stuff!!! They won't touch their dog food until I top it off with TruDog dog food. The problem is there's not enough for 2 mouths to feed! I wish this came in a 10-15 lb size of larger. This bag (the only size available) only lasts a couple weeks because I don't give my dogs a cup each, just a "sprinkle."
customer_reviews.author: flacotonic

customer_reviews.title: Fast Delivery!
customer_reviews.text: Scent isn't wonderful and I did not taste it. These are nuggets and my dog didn't like them as much as the other TruDog so I will order the other one.
customer_reviews.author: bluebonnet

customer_reviews.title: She does love it and she is really very picky
customer_reviews.text: Sophie is a big dog and this bag of food only last about a 1-1/2 so I have to substitute other food with it because it is very expensive. She does love it and she is really very picky!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My "picky" eaters love this!
customer_reviews.text: My three dogs love this food - two of which are very "picky" eaters. I opened the bag and gave each a little nugget. The picky eaters watched my other dog eat and then ate their nugget. Then I felt like the pied piper with everyone following me around for more. The directions suggest gradually introducing the dogs to the food. This one is the freeze-dried raw turkey. I'm on day four and each dog has been immediately eating their portions. I'm definitely going to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon O.

customer_reviews.title: No organic or Non GMO certification.
customer_reviews.text: Not organic or GMO free certification. Advertising is misleading. Free range is ok if GMO free, but it is not certified that way.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Food but way too expensive!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a wonderful dog food that helped my Goldendoodle get over a kidney infection along with us eliminating grains and the color red in her diet. It’s way too expensive to keep up. It was just 2 meals a bag. My Vet has her on another kidney function food and we mix it with Nutrish. 37.00 for 2 meals is ridiculous. If the price ever comes down I will be first in line.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Nester

product_meta.title: TruDog: Feed Me: Freeze Dried Raw Superfood - Real Meat Dog Food - Optimal Canine Health and Natural Longevity - All Natural - Balanced Nutrition - No Filters, No Grain - Just Add Water
feature_bullets: LESS IS A WHOLE LOT MORE: Raw Dog Food Made From 100% USA born, raised and harvested, cage free turkey.You will never find any grains, fillers, preservatives, or coloring in any of our products.
INGREDIENTS: Ground turkey with bone, turkey heart, turkey liver, herring oil, mixed tocopherols.

DAILY FEEDING GUIDELINES: To unleash the nutritious goodness of each serving, just add water, With no fillers in the food, you don't have to worry about TruDog losing its crunchy munchy goodness. Approximately 6 cups per bag. Feeding guidelines according to weight.

BENEFITS: No more foul smelling doggie breath, easy to digest, all-natural, hypoallergenic, appropriate for dogs of all ages and breeds, dog approved and dog preferred taste, no fear of food contamination or harmful effects of filler-laden kibble, happy healthy pets.
GUARANTEED: Safety and satisfaction guaranteed, proudly made in the U.S.A.

specifications.Item model number: Real Meat Organic Dog Food-Feed Me: Free
